I'm a physician, educator, and researcher. 

# Education
I graduated Medicine from [Ben-Gurion University, Israel](https://in.bgu.ac.il/en/pages/default.aspx); completed my Master of Health Administration cum laude from [Bar-Ilan University, Israel](https://www.biu.ac.il/en).

# Research experience
I have published over [20 scientific articles](https://scholar.google.co.il/citations?hl=en&user=ClzeE2UAAAAJ), received grants totaling 400K NIS + 40K USD, served as a [reviewer for five journals](https://publons.com/researcher/1394431/avishai-m-tsur/), mentored MD students, and wrote [a book chapter](https://www.routledge.com/Fundamentals-of-Frontline-Surgery/Khan-Nott/p/book/9780367435592). 

# Professional experience
I started volunteering as a first responder in [Magen David Adom, Israel](https://www.mdais.org/en). During my studies, I worked as a physician assistant in internal medicine. Later, I served as the director of physician assistants in [Soroka Medical Center, Israel](https://hospitals.clalit.co.il/soroka/en/Pages/default.aspx), where I also did my internship. Currently, I'm a resident in internal medicine in [Sheba Tel-Hashomer Medical Center, Israel](https://eng.sheba.co.il/)

# Teaching experience
I taught physics at [Ben-Gurion University, Israel](https://in.bgu.ac.il/en/pages/default.aspx) to biology, pharmacy, nursing, and medical students for over eight years. Later, I taught leadership and tactical medicine to paramedics and physicians. Currently, I teach medical students internal medicine and [R](https://www.r-project.org/) for biomedical research.

# Awards
In 2013-2014 I won twice the Best Speaker award of the Israeli National Debating Championship. In 2014 I also won an Intern's Award of Excellence from [Soroka Medical Center, Israel](https://hospitals.clalit.co.il/soroka/en/Pages/default.aspx). In 2017, I won an Award of Excellence from the Technological and Logistics Directorate, Israel Defense Forces. In 2019, an assay I first-authored won a creative writing contest by the Technological and Logistics Directorate, Israel Defense Forces. In 2020, my team won a Medical Data Science Hackathon for the Israel Defense Forces Medical Corps.

# Research interests
My main research interest is cardiology. However, I love to clean and wrangle data of all sorts so you can find my name on publications in tactical medicine, rheumatology, endocrinology, and even obstetrics.
